thread.title: Second GCC Games: Muhanna al Abdali bags three silver medals
thread.title_full: Second GCC Games: Muhanna al Abdali bags three silver medals

author: muscatdaily@apexmedia.co.om (Muscat Daily News)
title: Second GCC Games: Muhanna al Abdali bags three silver medals
text:
Second GCC Games: Muhanna al Abdali bags three silver medals Muhanna al Abdali (centre) with teammates and officials in Dammam October 18, 2015 
Oman's Muhanna al Abdali picked up the first medals for the sultanate on Friday when he claimed three silver in the clean, jerk and clean-and-jerk of 62kg weightlifting event at the second GCC Games in Dammam, Saudi Arabia, which was inaugurated on Thursday. 
Oman's volleyball team, with two wins, is in line for a medal with its concluding game against defending champion Bahrain on Sunday. 
Oman lost its opener to Qatar 2-3, but bounced back to beat UAE (3-2) and hosts Saudi Arabia (3-0) to collect with six points from three matches. Oman and Qatar have six points each from three matches, while Bahrain tops the standings with eight points from three wins in as many matches. 
Five teams are taking part in the round-robin championship - Bahrain, Qatar, UAE, Saudi Arabia and Oman - after Kuwait withdrew from the Games in the last minute. 
In the five-team handball event, Oman got off to a winning start on Saturday with a 30-26 win over UAE. 
Also, late on Saturday, Mohammed al Marhoobi won three silver medals in the 77kg weightlifting event. 
Omanâ€™s endurance riders claimed a bronze, while camel racing fetched two silver and one bronze to swell the medals tally to ten, which included eight silver and two bronze after three days of competitions. 
Earlier on Thursday, Khalid al Zubair, the Oman Olympic Committee (OOC) chief, attended the opening ceremony. Similar content
